reviews.review:
To start i dont like the original bioshock , nor its sequel.
and to that regard, gameplay wise it has little to do with them.
and that should say a lot of this game. for better or for worse.

the shooting is fun, simple linear fun.
it has a good story just, not an excelent one.
Its plotwisty and kidlike, but finely exposed.
i like the visual design of the game, and its lore. buildings, statues, enemies, weapons, everything is well crafted.

it's IMO the best single player fps from the ps3 and xbox360 era. 
That now it feels Like a nostalgic time capsule.
just, don't take the plot to seriously.

Best storyline in a video game I ever played by far.

Game design is perfect, the music and the lighting are beautiful.

[h1] 这他妈才叫第九艺术！！[/h1] 
[b] 无数个世界里无数的我们[/b]

玩完这款游戏过后，我整个人呆滞地坐在椅子上，半晌我才真的真的由衷地为这个游戏鼓掌，尽管这是一款13年的老游戏，却依然给了我其他所有3A大作根本无法企及其项背的震撼与感动。

  [h1] 无与伦比的蒸汽朋克风格+反乌托邦的世界观 [/h1] 
《生化奇兵：无限》塑造了一个蒸汽朋克风格的城市：哥伦比亚，哥伦比亚是一座声称脱离美国的浮空城市，游戏中的哥伦比亚有着十分显著的蒸汽朋克风格：飞空艇、热气球、巨大的钢铁机械、庞大的工厂群以及城市中十足的复古气息（很有辐射内味）……在明亮的光影衬托下，这座城市显得那么地美好而令人心驰神往——当然，在反乌托邦的题材中，美好的城市下往往隐藏着病态畸形的人心，游戏一开始我们的主角Booker在抽奖中抽中头奖——而奖励竟然是处死一对夫妇！游戏中这样的场景并不少见，因为哥伦比亚就是一座由以先知Comstock为首的极端种族主义分子The Founder所控制的城市。游戏对于世界观的塑造从细节下手，堪称完美。

[h1] 沉浸的游玩体验和超现实主义剧情 [/h1] 
这款游戏的沉浸感堪称一绝，让你不知不觉中仿若成为了主角Booker Dewwit一般已经难以从游戏的剧情中脱身，剧情的跌宕起伏都能深深牵动玩家的心弦[spoiler] 这大概也是为什么我在最后一章在得知”无限“的秘密后感受到了巨大的震撼 [/spoiler] 游戏剧情绝对是游戏最大的亮点，游戏的剧情是”超现实主义“风格的“——生与死的界限被模糊、时间的概念变得无意义、未来与世界的”无限“……在这样的空间与时间模糊的世界中，我们无从辩证”真实“为何[spoiler] 在游戏终章时，我们连主角的生与死都无从辨明 [/spoiler] ，如果你能认真体会到游戏剧情的魅力，那么我相信，这个游戏也会让你难以自拔。

[h1]富有特色的战斗系统[/h1]
游戏的战斗系统若要和剧情与氛围比较确实略逊色几分，但是实际上战斗系统也是为了剧情的推进而服务的。游戏里我非常喜欢一只手开枪一只手释放异能的感觉，极其淋漓尽致，枪械的射击手感也不算糟糕。 [spoiler] 不过美中不足的就是很多异能和枪械实在略显鸡肋，全程实际上只需要一把左轮就能打爆全场了，不过在面对复数种类的敌人时游戏也会变得十分有挑战性，这时其它枪械的用处就会彰显出来了[/spoiler] 


[h1] 以上那么多话简单来说就是，如果你想体验一部真正的FPS剧情神作，那么，买就是了！ [/h1]
good shit

生化奇兵：无限绝对称得上是第九艺术的巅峰。

天正蓝，花正香，咬一口新鲜羊角，品一杯红酒醇香，巴黎正美好。

再见，伊丽莎白。

Le ciel est bleu, les fleurs sont parfumées, mange un morceau d'un croissant frais, bois un verre de vin rouge, Paris est au bon moment.

Au revoir, Elisabeth.

生化奇兵系列看似没有HE，但是每个结局都是对角色最饱满的诠释，就像人生一样。我们或许和伊丽莎白一样，有着自己的“巴黎”。但是我们却因为种种原因，再也到达不了那里。
精美的画面 优秀的剧情 令人沉迷的游戏性 比玩游戏之一 赶快去玩！

[h1]One of the best story-rich FPS of all time.[/h1]

[b]If you've played BioShock 1 & 2, [u]especially 1,[/u] then you're in for a treat & I'd suggest you to buy both [i]Burial at Sea[/i] DLCs. The ending of the main game will blow your mind. Those DLCs kinda travels back to the very beginning & wrap things up, explains what started it all, why & when.[/b]
If you've never played any previous BioShock games, I'd suggest you to buy this game anyway for the amazing game-play mechanics paired with a unique combat system. Stay away from both [i]Burial at Sea[/i] DLCs as you'll probably have no idea what's going on.
[b]Get [i]Clash in the Clouds[/i] DLC for some creative combat challenges. [i]Columbia's Finest[/i] DLC isn't worth it unless you're looking to complete your BioShock collection.[/b]

[h1]Environment[/h1]
The game takes place in a floating city. The city is really beautiful & no place feels empty. The game does an awesome job at visual storytelling as you'd expect from a BioShock game. There are so many assets in every corner of the map, which makes you wanna actually take the time to look at them instead of just walking past them to continue with your current objective. It's worth mentioning that you never die from falling off the city during combat or exploration. You'll just spawn very close to the area you were in - almost instantly without any consequences. You can still die from dropping to the ground from really high heights though, especially if your health is low. If you're looking for some good soundtracks, this game has none. No music matches with the different atmospheres the game has to offer. This is really not that noticeable because most of the time there's several sound effects of whatever is happening around you, along with various NPC dialogues. Almost every level has some [b]Sky-Lines[/b] & [b]Freight Hooks[/b] which is an awesome way to traverse the area. Overall, the world feels very detailed & alive. Don't expect realistic graphics though, as the game is from 2013 but still, I think graphics could have been better. Lights are way too bright in some places & it can be annoying at times. Meshes of a few objects look really outdated. At least Elizabeth looks beautiful - you don't want to spend your time with a character that looks ugly. Engraved weapons look great too.

[h1]Story[/h1]
[i]I'll try my best not to spoil anything but if you think you should skip this section, feel free to do so.[/i]
When you arrive at the floating city, the game puts all the combat aside to let you take a good look at what kind of things you might expect to encounter in the near future, that level is very well designed. It's like a tutorial without it feeling like a tutorial, if that makes sense. Unlike the previous games where the main climaxes were at the very end, this game throws in some twists every now & then but saves the big surprise for the end. This doesn't make any of your mission feel boring even though the game is quite long. There are [b]Voxophones[/b] scattered throughout the game which serve as audio logs & most of them contain important information of the main story-line. I highly recommend finding & listening to all of them. You'll do most of your journey with [b]Elizabeth.[/b] She'll interact with various objects in the world & speak some dialogues at certain locations, after seeing some objects etc. You'll never feel like you're with a lifeless character the game is forcing you to be with for the story. She has so many dialogues & some of them are surprising & funny. The story of this game is really very complex. It's a good thing that you can replay every single chapter of the game. So if you don't understand something (especially near the end), just replay the chapter & try to listen carefully what the character(s) are saying. There is only 1 ending however, you'll be presented with some choices during the main story-line, none of them will affect the ending. [spoiler]The choice to throw the ball in the early level has a benefit of giving you 1 extra [b]Gear[/b] later in the game. Choosing what Elizabeth wears (bird or cage) is purely cosmetic. Choosing to take a knife to the hand or shooting first is mostly cosmetic too except it'll only affect 2 dialogues in the same level & won't be brought up again.[/spoiler]

[h1]Game-play[/h1]
You have 1 weapon in one hand & 1 [b]Vigor[/b] in the other. Vigors provide unique powers that can help you in combat & with some other stuff in the environment. Using vigors require [b]Salts.[/b] Elizabeth can find salts, money, health & ammo for you from time to time, even during combat. There are total 14 weapons & 8 vigors in the main game. 12 of your weapons & all vigors can be upgraded. You can have 2 weapons at a time, not counting the melee weapon & can have all of your vigors at the same time but can only carry 2 vigors for quick-access. All upgrades require purchases using in-game money in different types of vending machines. There are total 3 different vending machines that you can use: [b]"Minuteman's Armory"[/b] for upgrading weapons, [b]"Veni! Vidi! Vigor!"[/b] for upgrading vigors & [b]"Dollar Bill"[/b] for purchasing general stuff like ammo, health & salts. These machines can be found in lots of places. You can find in-game currency [b]Silver Eagles[/b] in so many places in the game. You can search tons of things in the world to find food, ammo, salts, health & money. All this might seem a bit confusing but it's really not. You can do a little trick on vending machines with a vigor of yours to get more benefits.

[h1]Combat[/h1]
Combat is awesome in the game & there are a lot of enemy encounters. What makes combat fun is the combination of vigor usage & taking advantage of sky-lines among other stuff thanks to Elizabeth. Using a vigor followed by another one can have cool effects. You have an arguably invisible [b]Shield[/b] that absorbs some of the damage before breaking but it recharges automatically & infinite number of times without the need of any resources. Don't be disappointed in the fact that you can only carry 2 main weapons at a time. There's always that perfect weapon for that perfect situation - dead enemies also drop weapons. You can choose to keep a heavy hitting weapon as a secondary for emergencies & keep switching your primary weapon to try out different stuff as there are a lot of weapons available. Enemy encounters, most of the time come with a few normal enemies, some machines & a mini-boss near the end. There are 11 enemy types in the main game. [spoiler]From the weakest to strongest (in my opinion): [b]Founder's Police & its Vox alternative, Gun Automation, Mosquito, Rocket Automation, Zealot of the Lady, Beast, Fireman, Boy of Silence, Motorized Patriot & its Vox alternative, Siren, Handyman & its Vox alternative.[/b] Of course, you'll not encounter them in that order in the game.[/spoiler] You can temporarily turn any enemy into your side, ask for Elizabeth's help in combat & can do really great stuff if there's a sky-line available near the fighting area. It's important to note that Elizabeth doesn't need protection during any combat encounters as she'll stay hidden behind a cover. [spoiler]Elizabeth can help you by opening a [b]Tear[/b] of your choice during combat, that can bring weapons / ammo / health / salts / freight hooks / covers etc.[/spoiler] You have a useful melee weapon that can perform executions on most enemies & it also helps you use freight hooks & sky-lines. Defeating mini-bosses require different strategies & it's a good thing. Some of the vigors are great for laying down traps & for specific enemy types while others are just fun to use in general.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[b]This game has a mind blowing story & one of a kind combat system. It's so hard to think of any reason why I should not recommend this to someone. Get this game even if you don't care about the story, the combat & overall game-play will more than make up for it.[/b]

TLDR:  Enjoyable game, beautifully put together

I'm a big fan of the first Bioshock game and I liked the second one, though the instability and crashing was unforgivable, so I approached Bioshock Infinite with hope but a little caution.

BS Infinite moves the story from the underwater city of Rapture and the 1950s-60s to the floating city of Columbia and is set in the 1910s. The player assumes the role of Booker DeWitt, a former soldier and Pinkerton man (private detective and hired thug) with a shady past filled with morally-questionable actions. DeWitt owes an unspecified debt and it told to infiltrate Columbia and retrieve a young woman named Elizabeth and bring her to New York to clear said debt. This almost immediately leads to trouble and the game is off and running.

Gameplay is fairly standard Bioshock fare: fire weapon with left click, active plasmid (here, called vigors) with the right. One catch is that unlike the first two games, the player can only carry two weapons. There will likely be occasions where you have to ditch a weapon you like because you are low on ammo for it, to grab one for which you're ammo-full. The vigors will feel somewhat familiar to Bioshock players but they aren't precise reskins of the old plasmids. All weapons and vigors can be upgraded in vending machines, and supplies purchased as well. Currency is in the form of Columbia silver eagles (dollar coins), and food and kits (for health) and blue bottles of salt (mana to power your vigors) can be found littering Columbia's shops, factories and streets.

BS Infinite does have two features unique to the franchise. One, the player will early-on earn a sky-hook, which can be used to grapple various loading cranes and slide down overhead tram-car rails. These become important, as it is not only how DeWitt will progress to new areas, but also becomes tactically important in order to reach cover, available weapons, or attack from above. The enemy can also ride these rails and you can end up in a running gun battle with soldiers while you're all riding the rails. Mounting and dismounting the hooks and rails is very fast and a little vertigo-inducing, though I admit, it is gratifying to dismount and plummet right at a foe and watch him scream in terror just as you collide.

Second, once DeWitt finds Elizabeth, she will accompany him around Columbia and is surprisingly helpful. The player doesn't have to guard her; she can't be hurt by the enemy or anything. But she will do things for the player, like pick locks to secured areas (if you've found lockpicks for her). She will sometimes find money and flip the coins to you. During combat, if DeWitt is low on ammo or salts, Elizabeth may find them and throw them to the player. These resources are not limitless, and she will frantically tell you if she can't find anything. Most of all, she learns how to open "tears" (rips, not crying) in the world. During different battles, she is able to tear-in weapons, medical kits, salts, flammable oil slicks, hook points for your sky-hook, cover to hide you from bullets, or even allies. I recommend trying different strategies, just to see what happens. There are usually multiple workable options in those battles, and I like the flexibility.

Once things get going, Comstock, the leader of Columbia, will start sending people to stop the player. First, police. Then soldiers. Then other big things. Then other factions get involved.  Some elite foes are just tougher versions of the base enemies, and some are totally different, requiring their own strategies. On human enemies, headshots count and hit hard, so I recommend keeping one zoomable-weapon, like the carbine or sniper rifle, to make enemies drop fast at a distance, especially on harder difficulties. Use of various weapons, vigors, and the environment (riding the sky-lines or opening tears) will help with tougher foes. Experiment and see what works best for you. I found the combat to generally be smoother and more enjoyable than either of the first two games and players that are tactical and plan their fights, as well as those who operate on reflexes can both be successful in these battles.

The environments in Columbia are gorgeous and colorful. The dress, decor, and architecture very much capture that turn-of-the-twentieth-century feel. The player is constantly reminded they are in a floating city, since there are numerous places one can fall to their death if careless. Graphics-wise, with a GTX 1070, even on max settings, the graphics felt smooth and frame rate consistent.

I personally found the voice-acting and music top-notch.  You could close your eyes and easily identify a dozen characters by their voices alone, and even most enemies. Gun-fire, explosions, the clank of the vending machines, chugging the vigor bottles...all very well done. The actress voicing Elizabeth did such an excellent job you can almost feel the girl's pain in some scenes.

I did find the base story workable but ambitious; it seemed a little more convoluted than it had to be. Explanations for the "why" of the floating city, the "how" of vigor invention, and the "who" of the major players, can be found by listening to voxphones (recorders) and watching old news reels but overall, I found the story less riveting than BS1 and less emotional than BS2. None of the characters other than Elizabeth are particularly likable, including DeWitt himself, so you'll be playing an almost-as-big-a-bastard as the story's main antagonist...which ultimately makes sense as his history is revealed.

The biggest drawback in Infinite for me was relegating the player to a checkpoint save system, after BS1 & BS2 allowed save on demand. We're on PC, so there is no excuse for not having the option. This is one of my pet peeves; I find it quite annoying and it always feels like lack of effort on the developer's part. The game itself was also quite short; the first time through, on average difficulty, I felt like I did a lot of gawking, exploring, and wandering; I reloaded several fights and took my time--and I still finished in about seventeen hours. Fortunately, the game is good enough to play through a couple of times.

I didn't have many stability problems but did have a handful of crashes. Nothing to really be bothersome. Also a few locks on exiting.

The DLCs are okay. Clash in the Clouds is the best "battle room" DLC in the Bioshock series and the Blue Ribbon Challenges are variable and fun, though a few will test your patience. The good news about those is that you keep your infusions, gear, upgrades and cash from challenge to challenge (or even if you start one over), which helps. The CiC runs are actually good for just practicing combat. Burial at Sea is a weird mash-up of BS1 and BS Infinite, in concept and content, with some resource management challenges. I was left unsatisfied by the resolution of it and felt like the story was borderline nonsensical. If you have not played Bioshock 1, Burial at Sea is all spoilers for that game. You've been warned.

The Steam achievements are, for the most part, not too bad. As of this writing, I've completed about 3/4 of them. One is to play the game on max difficulty and not purchase anything from the vendors, so that will definitely be a challenge. One nice feature is that the many of the achievements are cumulative from play through to play through. You can abuse the checkpoint system to rapidly finish others.

Overall, BS Infinite is a great game. Visually and audibly appealing, fast-paced, and a lot of fun. I'd recommend any gamer spend a little time in Columbia.

Pros
- Fun, fluid combat
- Gorgeous environments, superb voice acting & sound effects

Cons
- Checkpoint saves!
- Story is just okay, not as compelling as previous franchise entries


Final Score: 8/10

非常不错。游戏剧情很有深度，部分事物还折射了现实社会。人物描写出色。士兵的对话也蛮有意思。环境描写不多说，开头更是充满了温馨的生活气息。不过游戏性不是很高，全程只有突突突，不过由于其他方面的优秀刻画，还是能玩下去的。整体来说非常不错。不过结局有点迷。

Excellent gameplay, engaging story, interesting characters, anyone that says this is the worst Bioshock is either a sweaty "fan"boy of the first two games or just plain dumb, Infinite and its DLC are the best games in the trilogy, and i would recommend you play them before Bioshock 1 and 2 since the act as semi-prequels, i know i wouldnt have given Bioshock 1 a second chance had i not felt the overbearing need to do what you do at the end of the first game after seeing how Burial At Sea ends, definetly a bust buy.
this game is over all the best bioshock game if you are afriad of heights your in a sky city... but if not this is the game for you

Эта игра произвела большое впечатление именно из-за сюйжета,конечно же после прохождения игры я его абсолютно не понял и пошёл на ютуб за объяснением концовки, и когда я понял что произошло в финале игры меня просто осенило на сколько же сюйжет проработаный. У меня давно не было такого ,чтобы я прошёл игру и остался впечетлен от сюйжета и лора игры. Она мне на долго запомниться и станет одной из лучших игр из моего топ 10

Część ta zabiera nas z podwodnego, zruinowanego Rapture do powietrznej,tętniącej życiem Kolumbii. Nie zdradzając za wiele szczegółów odnośnie fabuły,powiem tak-wiele plottwistów, wyśmienice poprowadzona historia,dobrze stworzone postaci(polecam zbierać wiadomości audio bo można się z nich wiele dowiedzieć).Co do samej rozgrywki to prócz klasycznych plasmidów(w tej części wigorów) mamy  pułapki,dostępne beczki z broniami(w tej części możemy mieć tylko 2 bronie naraz),i apteczek.Po skończeniu fabuły czekają nas dodatki,które nas zabierają zpowrotem do Rapture i historia jest podzielona na 2 części. Nie mówiąc o trybie walki w chmurach,gdzie odpieramy fale przeciwników,zbierając pieniądze na ulepszenia zapewniając tym kolejne godziny zabawy. Podsumowując-jedna z najlepszych gier tej dekady.
yes yes good  very goood

Amazing, just amazing. The atmosphere, the story. Never boring, balanced. 12 hours of joy and excitement. It was too long on my list of shame. Should have played it much earlier. Booker DeWitt you Bastard!

game felt very mediocre and i don´t see any replay value at all.

[h1] 这是一首关于救赎的赞歌。 [/h1]
很难通过文字表达出这部作品的震撼，关于时空主题的游戏也玩过不少，游玩前也看了一部分剧透，但还是一次又一次的被震撼到了。
刚开始游玩生化奇兵无限的时候并没有一代游玩时的那种爽快感，前中期资源布置有明显的问题，超能力也没有一代的丰富实用，武器只能带两把，但也能真切的感受到作者在这一代把重点完全放在了剧情以及伊丽莎白的刻画上。“无限”并没有一代里那么令人印象深刻的反派，但在舞台效果和剧情深度上已经超越了我目前玩过的所有游戏，惊世骇俗。
[b] 他们用生命斩断了宿命，无论世界循环多少次，终有一天，我相信伊丽莎白会迎来巴黎明媚的阳光。 [/b]
挺不错的游戏，DLC海葬二部曲将第三部和第一部的结局故事关联了起来
good game

A better version of far cry 5 LMAO.

This game story will blow your freaking mind. Its is unbelievable staged from the beginning. And the way it approach to ending is incredible.  In addition, its not just story line, its game play FPS through out the game is surprisingly good too. Recommended for gamers who want to play good single player story games.

I played Bioshock 1 with pleasure, but due to lack of time, I skipped Bioshock 2 and I have been postponing Bioshock Infinite for several years. So, I've played it only now in 2020.

Last years were very poor on good FPS games. First thing that I can say is that Bioshock Infinite does not look outdated in 2020. It's still a great game with good detailed graphics. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and music. What I like most is the character of Elizabeth. She acts like alive, she is so beautiful and emotionally rich. The game worth playing just because of her.

I see that many people underline the brilliant story, and I agree on it. What I like is that the story is finished and debatable at the same time. Most importantly, the game does not keep a gamer as a fool and does not try to explain every detail to you, so you will have to figure out something by yourself.

What I did not like is actually the battle gameplay. All this roller coaster jumping and shooting are so childish. The levels are beautiful, but they are not designed for a good battle. For example, recently I've been re-playing Wolfenstein The New Order, and when an action scenes were starting, I felt happy about it. Here, I've noticed that I felt rather tired and I wanted them to end to see the continuation of the story.
SI

这游戏我很难评价，画面真的很美，而且后期有一种反乌托邦的感觉，因为没玩过之前几部，所以剧情上勉强能看懂，但是并不是很深入了解，就算你没玩过之前几部，也不影响游戏，这画风让我想起疯狂爱丽丝那游戏，有一种童话般的感觉，还是一款比较值得玩的游戏！
就这剧情、就这对人性的思考、就这贫富差距描述反乌托邦的立意，买爆就完事儿了

Muy buen juego, a medida que avanzas en la historia te va atrayendo mas, lo unico malo a mi consideracion, seria el gameplay, que es siempre lo mismo y las misiones son algo repetitivas, pero eso lo arregla con la buena trama e historia.

这个游戏最棒的是场景和音乐。
场景十分精致，天空之城真的美呆。
音乐也是复古的风格，很有格调。
难得的是剧情也十分有意思。开始我以为把伊丽莎白带回去交差是我的任务；后来我以为和伊丽莎白一起去巴黎生活是我的目标，直到结尾我才直到这究竟是一个怎样的故事。
一起都串联起来了。

除此之外，游戏有比较复杂的战斗系统，让你很难感受到枯燥。
Excelente lpm 10/10
牛逼牛逼

One of my favorite games of all time. So much atmosphere, the world feels alien yet lived in, and the lighting is just incredible. Elizabeth's AI is so mindbogglingly natural that I never once felt that she was a robot; She always felt [b]alive[/b]. The music is great, the combat is fantastic, and I'm reviewing it because I felt like it's unfair that the current 94% rating doesn't qualify for "overwhelmingly positive".
Awesome
An amazing and classic game! If you haven't had people tell you about Bioshock already, I'd be surprised.
